href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/20/summer-party-ideas/\" rel=\"bookmark\">4 Summer Party Ideas To Make Your Next Summer Bash A Hit</a></h2> \n<p class=\"entry-meta\"><time class=\"entry-time\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" datetime=\"2017-04-20T07:00:47+00:00\">04/20/2017</time> By <span class=\"entry-author\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/author/Jenn/\" class=\"entry-author-link\" itemprop=\"url\" rel=\"author\"><span class=\"entry-author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">Jenn</span></a></span> <span class=\"entry-comments-link\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/20/summer-party-ideas/#respond\">Leave a Comment</a></span> </p></header><div class=\"entry-content\" itemprop=\"text\"><p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39485\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/4-Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit.jpg\" alt=\"4 Summer Party Ideas To Make Your Next Summer Bash A Hit\" width=\"700\" height=\"1000\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/4-Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit.jpg 700w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/4-Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit-210x300.jpg 210w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\"></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There’s nothing like having a good cookout in the summer with family and friends from the neighborhood. A simple summer celebration can turn into the best summer bash in no time with a few additions like special activities and the best food. Do a little research to see what others in the neighborhood are doing so that you don’t copy anyone, making your bash completely unique.</span></p>\n<h3>Here are 4 Summer Party Ideas To Make Your Bash A Hit!</h3>\n<div id=\"GA_VAST\"></div><div id=\"ga_os_7170982\" style=\"text-align: center; overflow: visible; visibility: visible;\">\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n     apntag.anq.push(function() {\n        apntag.showTag('ga_os_7170982');\n        });\n</script>\n</div>\n<br><p><strong>Light It Up</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your backyard bash can sparkle in the evening with a few sparklers and fireworks. Make sure that the fireworks that you use are legal in your state. Also, you can put <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2oJHEqM\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">glow sticks</span></a> in clear jars to light up the tables, giving a fun glow to the evening. Let guests bring their favorite fireworks to set off so that everyone can join in on the fun.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39486\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit.jpg\" alt=\"4 Summer Party Ideas To Make Your Next Summer Bash A Hit\" width=\"650\" height=\"374\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit.jpg 650w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Summer-Party-Ideas-To-Make-Your-Next-Summer-Bash-A-Hit-300x173.jpg 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px\"></p>\n<p><strong>Game Time</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You want to have plenty of games for your guests. Find games that are fun for adults and games that children can play as well. Offer prizes for the winners, such as a gift card to a restaurant or even money. If guests enjoy the time at your bash, they will want to come back in the future, which means you’ll have new friends at every turn. Hula hoops and <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2o1jrgV\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">bubbles</span></a> also work along with sidewalk chalk so that you can remember the event. </span></p>\n<p><strong>Make a Splash</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you don’t already have one for your yard, get a pool, like those that </span><a href=\"http://www.poolstoreinc.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Pool Store</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> has, for people to enjoy at your bash. It can be something simple like the inflatable pools that are four-feet high. As long as you offer a way for guests to get cool, then they will usually be very grateful. Have a few pool toys and floats, especially for the younger crowd as they enjoy doing things other than just swimming in circles. Set up a smaller pool for toddlers so that they can enjoy the time as well and you don’t have to worry about them so much.</span></p>\n<p><a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2014/08/04/tropical-pineapple-dip/\"><img class=\"aligncenter  wp-image-34275\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/pineapple-dip-679x1024.jpg\" alt=\"summer pineapple dip\" width=\"609\" height=\"918\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/pineapple-dip-679x1024.jpg 679w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/pineapple-dip-199x300.jpg 199w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/pineapple-dip.jpg 1000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 609px) 100vw, 609px\"></a></p>\n<p><strong>Feed the Belly</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">No summer party&nbsp;is complete without delicious food. If you want to save a little money, then ask others to bring their favorite dishes. Offer a balance of traditional foods, like burgers and hot dogs, along with a few new items, like this <a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2014/08/04/tropical-pineapple-dip/\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">tropical pineapple dip</span></a>&nbsp;or bratwurst on the grill. Kale chips are an idea if you want a side item that is healthy but fun to eat. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your summer party&nbsp;will be one to remember if you pay attention to detail. Provide entertainment in various forms, such as games and music. Also, don’t forget the decorations as you don’t want a simple party with nothing to look at but grass and tables. With these 4 summer party ideas your friends and family will have a great time!&nbsp;</span></p>\n<p>What are your favorite summer party ideas when you throw a backyard bash?&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This is a guest post written by&nbsp;Hannah Whittenly. Hannah is a freelance writer from Sacramento, California. A mother of two, Hannah enjoys writing on blogs of all niches.</p>\n<!-- Simple Share Buttons Adder (6.3.4) simplesharebuttons.com --><div class=\"ssba ssba-wrap\"><div style=\"text-align:left\">Share tag-monitoring-teens-cell-phone tag-parenting tag-teens tag-teens-cell-phone entry\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/CreativeWork\"><header class=\"entry-header\"><h2 class=\"entry-title\" itemprop=\"headline\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/18/monitor-teens-cell-phone-usage/\" rel=\"bookmark\">How Parents Can Manage and Monitor Their Teens Cell Phone Usage</a></h2> \n<p class=\"entry-meta\"><time class=\"entry-time\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" datetime=\"2017-04-18T07:00:07+00:00\">04/18/2017</time> By <span class=\"entry-author\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/author/Jenn/\" class=\"entry-author-link\" itemprop=\"url\" rel=\"author\"><span class=\"entry-author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">Jenn</span></a></span> <span class=\"entry-comments-link\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/18/monitor-teens-cell-phone-usage/#respond\">Leave a Comment</a></span> </p></header><div class=\"entry-content\" itemprop=\"text\"><p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39479\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/How-Parents-Can-Manage-and-Monitor-Their-Teens-Cell-Phone-Usage.jpg\" alt=\"How Parents Can Manage and Monitor Their Teens Cell Phone Usage\" width=\"700\" height=\"1000\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/How-Parents-Can-Manage-and-Monitor-Their-Teens-Cell-Phone-Usage.jpg 700w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/How-Parents-Can-Manage-and-Monitor-Their-Teens-Cell-Phone-Usage-210x300.jpg 210w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\"></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is no denying that cell phones have become a powerful and productive force in our society. At the same time, they can limit our ability to communicate effectively, and danger can lurk within if the devices are not properly managed. This is particularly true for young people. </span></p>\n<h3><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Consider the following four ways that parents can manage and monitor their teens cell phone usage. </span></h3>\n<div id=\"GA_VAST\"></div><div id=\"ga_os_7170982\" style=\"text-align: center; overflow: visible; visibility: visible;\">\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n     apntag.anq.push(function() {\n        apntag.showTag('ga_os_7170982');\n        });\n</script>\n</div>\n<br><p><strong>Make Them off Limits at School</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">School should be a place for learning. Phones can be a distraction, and teens can rack up quite a bill when they think nobody else is looking. While computers might be useful tools in a school environment, phones are not. Avoid the temptation that your teen will have to misuse the phone and require that it stay either in their locker or at home. </span></p>\n<p><strong>Turn Them Off at Night</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Teens are already notorious for not getting enough sleep at night. This is becoming even more serious of a problem today as more and more young people are using their phones all night to test and talk to their friends in the privacy of their own rooms. While building friendships is what being a teenager is all about, it should not be done so at the compromise of a good night’s sleep. Require that they be switched off after a certain hour. </span></p>\n<p><strong>Secure an International Data Plan</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">More and more young people are traveling abroad these days. Mobile phones are certainly a useful piece of technology to have, as it will enable your teen to keep in touch with friends and family in relatively easy fashion. At the same time, you need to make sure that you have an </span><a href=\"https://ultramobile.com/monthly-plans\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">international data plan</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> assigned to the phone in order to avoid those sky high charges hitting you when your teen returns home. Managing your phone bills can be a little daunting, but it is definitely possible.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Use Centralized Billing</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you have a centralized bill, you will be able to see how many text message and data your teen is using. This isn’t about you checking up on them; rather, it is about you managing the limited resources that you have as a parent. Boundaries should be set on how much the phone can be used.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These four tips can help you, as a parent, better manage your teens cell phone usage. At the end of the day, you want your teen to be independent and free to learn from his or her own shortcomings. It is your job to also protect them at the same time, so consider these tips as a way to do just that.</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><em>This is a guest post: Rachelle Wilber is a freelance writer living in the San Diego, California area. class=\"entry-header\"><h2 class=\"entry-title\" itemprop=\"headline\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/13/health-exams-youngster-maintain-health/\" rel=\"bookmark\">4 Health Exams Every Youngster Needs to Maintain Their Health</a></h2> \n<p class=\"entry-meta\"><time class=\"entry-time\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" datetime=\"2017-04-13T07:00:27+00:00\">04/13/2017</time> By <span class=\"entry-author\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/author/Jenn/\" class=\"entry-author-link\" itemprop=\"url\" rel=\"author\"><span class=\"entry-author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">Jenn</span></a></span> <span class=\"entry-comments-link\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/13/health-exams-youngster-maintain-health/#respond\">Leave a Comment</a></span> </p></header><div class=\"entry-content\" itemprop=\"text\"><p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39473\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Health-Exams-Every-Youngster-Needs-to-Maintain-Their-Health.jpg\" alt=\"Health Exams Every Youngster Needs to Maintain Their Health\" width=\"700\" height=\"1000\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Health-Exams-Every-Youngster-Needs-to-Maintain-Their-Health.jpg 700w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Health-Exams-Every-Youngster-Needs-to-Maintain-Their-Health-210x300.jpg 210w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\"></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Health exams and screening tests should start as early in life as possible. The early detection of health conditions such as diabetes or hearing loss allow for prompt treatment. Be sure to schedule routine visits with your child’s pediatrician so these important tests can be performed on an annual basis.</span></p>\n<h4>4 Health Exams Every Youngster Needs to Maintain Their Health</h4>\n<div id=\"GA_VAST\"></div><div id=\"ga_os_7170982\" style=\"text-align: center; overflow: visible; visibility: visible;\">\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n     apntag.anq.push(function() {\n        apntag.showTag('ga_os_7170982');\n        });\n</script>\n</div>\n<br><p><strong>Urine and Blood Tests</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tests of your child’s urine and blood help to detect chronic conditions such as <a href=\"http://ctitbytrk.com/?a=304&amp;oc=500&amp;c=5085&amp;s1=\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">diabetes</span></a> and kidney disease. These medical issues are developing more frequently in children. If you have a family history of diabetes or you had gestational diabetes during <a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2015/05/20/healthy-pregnancy/\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">your pregnancy</span></a>, these screening tests should be performed once per year to monitor your child’s health status.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Pediatrician Visits</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Visits to the pediatrician are important to monitoring your child’s overall health. During routine visits to the pediatrician, the doctor will measure your child’s height and weight. Professionals, like those at </span><a href=\"http://www.entirafamilyclinics.com/MedicalServices/NewbornPediatricandAdolescent.aspx\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Entira Family Clinics</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, realize that basic tests such as blood pressure and heart rate may also be performed. If your child is due for any vaccinations, the doctor will let you know. Well-child checkups are a good way to get to know the pediatrician and allow the doctor to understand your child’s overall health. This will help the doctor to care for your child during times of illness.</span><br>\n<a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=972312&amp;u=509874&amp;m=18769&amp;urllink=&amp;afftrack=\" target=\"_blank\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"http://static.shareasale.com/image/18769/17first50feb250300.jpg\" alt=\"Save 50% off First Order at Glassesshop.com with coupon code: FIRST50\" border=\"0\"></a><br>\n<strong>Vision Exams</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many <a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/02/09/superfoods-promote-positive-eye-health/\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">vision disorders are detected during a child’s first few years</span></a> of life. If your child bumps into things, trips a lot or seems to have trouble seeing pictures in a book, it is a good idea to request a vision exam from the pediatrician. This is a basic screening test that can detect myopia and presbyopia. If your doctor finds a problem with your child’s vision, a pediatric ophthalmologist referral can be provided.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Hearing Tests</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Children can be born with or develop conditions that cause a loss of hearing. A hearing test can help your pediatrician to sort out a medical hearing problem from a behavioral issue such as your child’s lack of listening or attention. If your child has had frequent ear infections, a hearing exam can detect any hearing loss that has happened as a result of damage to the inner ear.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Each of these tests only takes a few minutes to perform. This is a small investment of your time in order to protect your child’s health. You and the pediatrician can explain how the test will work, what it is for and why it is important. Explaining the importance of being healthy will help your child to cooperate.</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><em>This is a guest post: Rachelle Wilber is a freelance writer living in the San Diego, California area. She graduated from San Diego State University with her Bachelor’s Degree in Journalism and Media Studies. She tries to find an interest in all topics and themes, which prompts her writing. itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/CreativeWork\"><header class=\"entry-header\"><h2 class=\"entry-title\" itemprop=\"headline\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/12/bad-mom-society/\" rel=\"bookmark\">6 Reason’s I Am A Bad Mom According To Society &amp; I’m Perfectly Fine With That</a></h2> \n<p class=\"entry-meta\"><time class=\"entry-time\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" datetime=\"2017-04-12T07:00:41+00:00\">04/12/2017</time> By <span class=\"entry-author\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/author/Jenn/\" class=\"entry-author-link\" itemprop=\"url\" rel=\"author\"><span class=\"entry-author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">Jenn</span></a></span> <span class=\"entry-comments-link\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/12/bad-mom-society/#comments\">3 Comments</a></span> </p></header><div class=\"entry-content\" itemprop=\"text\"><p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39466\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/6-Reasons-I-Am-A-Bad-Mom-According-To-Society-Im-Perfectly-Fine-With-That.jpg\" alt=\"6 Reason's I Am A Bad Mom According To Society &amp; I'm Perfectly Fine With That\" width=\"700\" height=\"1000\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/6-Reasons-I-Am-A-Bad-Mom-According-To-Society-Im-Perfectly-Fine-With-That.jpg 700w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/6-Reasons-I-Am-A-Bad-Mom-According-To-Society-Im-Perfectly-Fine-With-That-210x300.jpg 210w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\"></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Kids, they do not come with instructions. As moms and dads, we try to do our very best every day to raise them as upstading human beings to society. So here is my question…</p>\n<div id=\"GA_VAST\"></div><div id=\"ga_os_7170982\" style=\"text-align: center; overflow: visible; visibility: visible;\">\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n     apntag.anq.push(function() {\n        apntag.showTag('ga_os_7170982');\n        });\n</script>\n</div>\n<br><p>Why is there so much judgement when it comes to someone’s parenting style? No one is perfect so why should parenting be? No one should be shamed and be called a bad mom, we do our best!&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We all make mistakes, learn as we go and that’s okay! Judge me if you will, I’m perfectly a-okay with that.&nbsp;</p>\n<h4>6 Reason’s I Am A Bad Mom According To Society &amp; I’m Perfectly Fine With That</h4>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Lying&nbsp;</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>Yes, I lie to my children! Nights that I could not cook<em> yet&nbsp;another</em> <a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2015/08/01/loaded-bbq-chicken-nachos/\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">chicken dinner</span></a> and make pork I tell them it’s chicken. I have been known to turn the lights off on them head to my room.&nbsp;Lock my bedroom door to pretend mommy is going to bed too just so they will go to bed.&nbsp;</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Cursing&nbsp;</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>I’m a NY girl at heart born and raised, we curse – alot! It adds character to what we are saying just like we talk alot with our hands. I have a potty mouth, I will not deny that. I curse in front of my kids, they know it is wrong for them to say the curse words, so they don’t. But, when they spell them back at me well, I check them for&nbsp;spelling it correctly.&nbsp;</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Eating Habits&nbsp;</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>In the beginning, I made all my kid’s baby food. Thought back then what a “perfect mother” I was, knowing everything that went into their mouths. All organic and healthy. Yeah, these days a couple nights through a drive thru won’t hurt them.&nbsp;</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39468\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/bad-mom-judegment.jpg\" alt=\"bad mom judgement \" width=\"640\" height=\"426\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/bad-mom-judegment.jpg 640w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/bad-mom-judegment-300x200.jpg 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px\"></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Patience&nbsp;</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>What patience? By the time they get home from school after I’ve, broken up fights about who was staring at who. Heard about someone not liking the lunch I packed for them after they picked out what they wanted the night before. Or my personal favorite the homework battle I’ve about lost it before we even make it through the door.&nbsp;I try my best not to get annoyed, I feel guilty after I’ve screamed my head off, I do! But between all the hats we wear sometimes kids just suck&nbsp;that last bit of patience out of you to the point where your head feels like it’s spinning out of control.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Me Time and Kids Screen Time</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>Gasp, I do not monitor my kids screen time. Now, let me clarify they do need to have their homework done that is a rule but after that it’s a free for all. They are allowed on game systems and iPads if they’d like to be until dinner. I take the me time when it is available and do not feel guilty about that either. Whether it’s 30 minutes every day while I’m cooking dinner while they play in their rooms. Or on the weekends, Ill take a day to get a pedicure, have lunch with my sister anything to de-stress.&nbsp;</p>\n<p><a href=\"http://aff.enadvncdtrk1.com/aff_c?offer_id=2075&amp;aff_id=391&amp;file_id=14083\" target=\"_blank\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"http://media.enimgs.net/brand/files/escalatenetwork/2075/bp300x250banner.jpg\" width=\"300\" height=\"250\" border=\"0\"></a><img src=\"http://aff.enadvncdtrk1.com/aff_i?offer_id=2075&amp;aff_id=391&amp;file_id=14083\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\"></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Breastfeeding&nbsp;</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>This is a more serious topic that is hugely judged. I did not breastfeed any one of my three children. With my first child I was unable and to be honest by the time I got to my third I wasn’t into it. I felt like the worst mother on this planet for the comments I&nbsp;received for not breastfeeding. Guess what, I did not care by the time I got to my last child. I know the health benefits, read all the books but what’s best for you may not be best for me so let’s not judge. Side note – I am going to flip this to the <a href=\"http://aff.enadvncdtrk1.com/aff_c?offer_id=2075&amp;aff_id=391\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">breast feeding momma’s</span></a>, I applaud you! You will never get a look from me out in public breast feeding your child. That is whole other topic, but why are these mother’s judged for feeding their child in public? You eat in public, right? Let that mom feed her baby in peace she does not need the stares and judgement. End rant!&nbsp;</p>\n<p>So conclusion, my kids are loved, they know that. Just because society thinks I may be a bad mom, I know I am not. Your kids, my kids, her kids are all taken care of to the best of our ability&nbsp;every single day. Our kids know that so why can’t other mother’s understand that?&nbsp;The mom guilt we have about other things we worry about is enough on ourselves, there doesn’t need to be this label of what makes you a good mom.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>What are things you do that makes you a bad mom according to society? Leave me a comment below, let’s keep it clean though.&nbsp;</p>\n<!-- Simple Share Buttons Adder (6.3.4) simplesharebuttons.com --><div class=\"ssba ssba-wrap\"><div style=\"text-align:left\">Share itemtype=\"http://schema.org/CreativeWork\"><header class=\"entry-header\"><h2 class=\"entry-title\" itemprop=\"headline\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/11/home-express-style/\" rel=\"bookmark\">4 Tips For Helping Your Home Express Your Style</a></h2> \n<p class=\"entry-meta\"><time class=\"entry-time\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" datetime=\"2017-04-11T07:00:16+00:00\">04/11/2017</time> By <span class=\"entry-author\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/author/Jenn/\" class=\"entry-author-link\" itemprop=\"url\" rel=\"author\"><span class=\"entry-author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">Jenn</span></a></span> <span class=\"entry-comments-link\"><a href=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2017/04/11/home-express-style/#comments\">3 Comments</a></span> </p></header><div class=\"entry-content\" itemprop=\"text\"><p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-39461\" src=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Tips-For-Helping-Your-Home-Express-Your-Style.jpg\" alt=\"Tips For Helping Your Home Express Your Style\" width=\"700\" height=\"1000\" srcset=\"https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Tips-For-Helping-Your-Home-Express-Your-Style.jpg 700w, https://www.morethanamomofthree.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Tips-For-Helping-Your-Home-Express-Your-Style-210x300.jpg 210w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\"></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your home is <a href=\"http://www.morethanamomofthree.com/2016/04/21/storage/\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">your personal sanctuary</span></a>. It’s a physical manifestation of your personal style. It’s important to put in the effort and make your home reflect your style for a few reasons. It allows you to feel comfortable in your space. It also allows others to get a better understanding of who you are as a person. </span></p>\n<h3><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you’re unsure of how to express your style through home decor, start with these four tricks. </span></h3>\n<div id=\"GA_VAST\"></div><div id=\"ga_os_7170982\" style=\"text-align: center; overflow: visible; visibility: visible;\">\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n     apntag.anq.push(function() {\n        apntag.showTag('ga_os_7170982');\n        });\n</script>\n</div>\n<br><p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>Mix of Old and New</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One of the best ways you allow your home to reflect your style is through mixing and matching of old and new items. Take a look at some of your favorite items from childhood. If you still have them, try to place them throughout the house. If there’s a clock or a vase that belonged to your parents, try and find a way to work it into the decor. These older pieces help tell the story of your past. If you have a favorite animal, find a small figurine of it and place it somewhere visible. It doesn’t need to match the decor verbatim, but can become an easy conversation piece. </span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=401160&amp;u=509874&amp;m=4313&amp;urllink=&amp;afftrack=\" target=\"_blank\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"http://static.shareasale.com/image/4313/AGPBanner071112.gif\" border=\"0\"></a><br>\n<strong>Artwork</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use artwork throughout your home to adequately express your style. If you have certain mantras or quotes you live by, get a <a href=\"http://shrsl.com/?hduz\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"color: #0000ff;\">custom-made canvas</span></a> with the words and hang them up. Look online and figure out what type of artwork you gravitate toward. Whether it’s a style of a specific artist or the mood a piece puts you in, try to gather artwork that makes you feel something. When you feel it, you’ll be able to invoke that feeling in your living space. </span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>Interests</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Consider some of the things you’re passionate about. If you’re an avid baseball fan or you’re in love with music, try to figure out neat ways to incorporate your passions into a room. If you love music, check out vintage shops to find a few vinyl records. Put them in a fun display case. You might even want to find a fun record player that you can use from time to time. If you really enjoy outdoor entertaining, set the ambiance with a custom patio from somewhere like </span><a href=\"http://lifestylepatios.com/services/decks/\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lifestyle Patios</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. You can even get really comfortable deck furniture and make it a place where people want to hang out. </span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;<a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=597113&amp;u=509874&amp;m=37430&amp;urllink=&amp;afftrack=\" target=\"_blank\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"http://static.shareasale.com/image/37430/Seating_300x250.gif\" border=\"0\"></a></p>\n<p><strong>Color</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While you may not want to put your favorite color all over the room, you can choose shades of your favorite color and try them in different sections. Take a look at the color wheel and see which colors relax you the most and include those in your home. </span><br>\n<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The more you experiment and infuse your passions, interests and things that make you light up, the more your personal style gets expressed. Don’t be afraid to take risks and have fun. It’s your home and you can make your own rules.</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Guest Post: Kara Masterson is a freelance writer from West Jordan, Utah. She graduated from the University of Utah and enjoys writing and spending time with her dog, Max.</p>\n<!-- Simple Share Buttons Adder (6.3.4) simplesharebuttons.com --><div class=\"ssba
